keyMoments.title: Issho's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: A blind man appears at a roulette table in Dressrosa, being cheated by thugs who exploit his disability. After Luffy exposes them, he reveals devastating gravity-based powers.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of one of the two new admirals recruited during the timeskip, establishing his incredible power and mysterious demeanor.
keyMoments.quote: I appreciate your concern, young man, but I can handle myself.

keyMoments.title: Gravity Powers Demonstration
keyMoments.description: Issho uses his Zushi Zushi no Mi powers to crush Doflamingo's thugs with overwhelming gravitational force, channeling the power through his sword.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of the Press-Press Fruit abilities, showcasing Fujitora as an elite-level combatant despite his blindness.

abilities.description: Issho can manipulate gravitational forces, crushing opponents with intense pressure or lifting objects and people into the air.

relationships.description: Luffy warns Issho about being cheated at roulette, establishing their first interaction before either knows the other's true identity.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy helps expose the cheating thugs, and Issho thanks him before demonstrating his power.

reveals.information: Possesses the Zushi Zushi no Mi Devil Fruit, granting gravity manipulation powers
Is completely blind but fights with incredible skill
Channels Devil Fruit powers through his sword in a reverse-grip style

keyMoments.title: Thunder Soldier Appears
keyMoments.description: A one-legged toy soldier appears at the Corrida Colosseum, warning children to stay away from the brutal arena. He is then pursued by guards as a wanted criminal.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of the legendary gladiator Kyros in his toy form, though his true identity and history remain mysterious at this point.
keyMoments.quote: Stay away from here, children! This place is too brutal for young eyes!

reveals.information: Appears as a one-legged toy soldier

keyMoments.title: Gatz Announces the Tournament
keyMoments.description: Gatz appears as the enthusiastic announcer of the Corrida Colosseum, bringing energy and excitement to the tournament opening ceremony.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the Colosseum's announcer who will narrate the tournament battles and later support Luffy during critical moments.
keyMoments.quote: Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, to the Corrida Colosseum!

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Mera Mera no Mi Prize
keyMoments.description: Gatz dramatically announces that the Mera Mera no Mi - Ace's former Devil Fruit - is the tournament's grand prize, shocking the audience.
keyMoments.significance: This announcement sets the entire tournament arc in motion and forces Luffy to make a critical decision about entering.
keyMoments.quote: Today's prize for the winner of this tournament is none other than... the Mera Mera no Mi! The legendary Flame-Flame Fruit that once belonged to Fire Fist Ace!

reveals.information: Official announcer of the Corrida Colosseum

keyMoments.title: Luffy Sees Ace's Devil Fruit
keyMoments.description: Luffy witnesses the Mera Mera no Mi being announced as the tournament prize and becomes emotionally overwhelmed, seeing his late brother's power being offered up.
keyMoments.significance: This moment forces Luffy to confront his grief over Ace's death and pushes him to make a decision that will affect the entire alliance's plan.

keyMoments.title: Decides to Enter the Tournament
keyMoments.description: Despite being unable to eat the fruit himself, Luffy declares his intention to enter the Corrida Colosseum tournament to protect Ace's legacy.
keyMoments.significance: This decision demonstrates Luffy's devotion to Ace's memory and sets up his involvement in the tournament, playing into Doflamingo's trap.
keyMoments.quote: I won't let anyone have Ace's power! I'm entering this tournament!

relationships.description: Luffy helps Issho by exposing the cheating thugs, establishing their first interaction.

evolutionMoments.description: First meeting between Luffy and the future Admiral Fujitora, though neither knows the other's identity.

reveals.information: Still deeply affected by Ace's death two years later
Determined to protect Ace's legacy by winning the Mera Mera no Mi

keyMoments.title: Shusui Stolen by Fairies
keyMoments.description: Zoro's prized sword Shusui is stolen by invisible 'fairies', along with other belongings from people in Dressrosa.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Zoro's pursuit subplot and introduces the mystery of the Tontatta tribe.

keyMoments.title: Pursues the Stolen Sword
keyMoments.description: Zoro spots his stolen Shusui and immediately gives chase with Sanji and Kin'emon.
keyMoments.significance: Begins Zoro's separate adventure in Dressrosa that will lead to discovering important secrets.
